model.units

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.units.Unit
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicUnit

    public abstract class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    The unit is the basic entity of the game. It it the superclass to all other autonomous units within the game. The unit performs tasks by pulling them from a global job queue and works on them until other needs otherwise present themselves.
    Author:
    Christopher Chapline, James Fagan, Emily Leones, Michelle Yung

    • Constructor Detail

      • Unit

        public Unit(java.lang.String name,
    java.util.HashMap<UnitSkill,java.lang.Integer> skills,
    int maxEnergyLevel,
    int maxHungerLevel,
    int location,
    int cols)
        Creates a unit that has a specific set of skills
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the unit
        skills - A map of skills
        maxEnergyLevel - The maximum amount of energy that this unit can have. They start the game at 75% of their max energy level. They will need to sleep at 15% of their max energy level.
        maxHungerLevel - The maximum amount of food energy that this unit can have. They start the game at 75% of their max hunger level. They will need to eat at 15% of their max energy level.

      • Unit

        public Unit(java.lang.String name,
    int maxEnergyLevel,
    int maxHungerLevel,
    int cols)
        Starts with the default skillset
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the unit
        maxEnergyLevel - The maximum amount of energy that this unit can have. They start the game at 75% of their max energy level. They will need to sleep at 15% of their max energy level.
        maxHungerLevel - The maximum amount of food energy that this unit can have. They start the game at 75% of their max hunger level. They will need to eat at 15% of their max energy level.
